Coverage.add.description: Adds the first value to the second for each matched pair of bands in image1 and image2. If either image1 or image2 has only 1 band, then it is used against all the bands in the other image. If the images have the same number of bands, but not the same names, they're used pairwise in the natural order. The output bands are named for the longer of the two inputs, or if they're equal in length, in image1's order. The type of the output pixels is the union of the input types.

args.name: coverage1
args.description: The image from which the left operand bands are taken.

args.name: coverage2
args.description: The image from which the right operand bands are taken.

Coverage.multiply.description: Multiplies the first value by the second. If either image1 or image2 has only 1 band, then it is used against all the bands in the other image. If the images have the same number of bands, but not the same names, they're used pairwise in the natural order. The output bands are named for the longer of the two inputs, or if they're equal in length, in image1's order. The type of the output pixels is the union of the input types.

args.name: coverage1
args.description: The image from which the left operand bands are taken.

args.name: coverage2
args.description: The image from which the right operand bands are taken.

Coverage.subtract.description: Subtracts the second value from the first for each matched pair of bands in image1 and image2. If either image1 or image2 has only 1 band, then it is used against all the bands in the other image. If the images have the same number of bands, but not the same names, they're used pairwise in the natural order. The output bands are named for the longer of the two inputs, or if they're equal in length, in image1's order. The type of the output pixels is the union of the input types.

args.name: coverage1

args.description: The image from which the right operand bands are taken.

Coverage.divide.description: Divides the first value by the second, returning 0 for division by 0 for each matched pair of bands in image1 and image2. If either image1 or image2 has only 1 band, then it is used against all the bands in the other image. If the images have the same number of bands, but not the same names, they're used pairwise in the natural order. The output bands are named for the longer of the two inputs, or if they're equal in length, in image1's order. The type of the output pixels is the union of the input types.

args.name: coverage1
args.description: The image from which the left operand bands are taken.

args.name: coverage2
args.description: The image from which the right operand bands are taken.

args.name: dataType

Coverage.polygonizeByGDAL.description: Creates vector polygons for all connected regions of pixels in the raster sharing a common pixel value. Each polygon is created with an attribute indicating the pixel value of that polygon.

args.name: extra
args.description: Add extra GDAL command line options

args.name: field

args.description: If the raster is multiband, choose the band you want to use

args.name: eightConnectedness
args.description: If not set, raster cells must have a common border to be considered connected (4-connected). If set, touching raster cells are also considered connected (8-connected).

Coverage.rasterizeOverByGDAL.description: Overwrites a raster layer with values from a vector layer. New values are assigned based on the attribute value of the overlapping vector feature.

args.name: inputRaster

args.name: extra
args.description: Add extra GDAL command line options

args.name: field
args.description: Defines the attribute field to use to set the pixels values

args.name: add
args.description: If False, pixels are assigned the selected field’s value. If True, the selected field’s value is added to the value of the input raster layer.

Feature.rasterizeOverFixedValueByGDAL.description: Overwrites parts of a raster layer with a fixed value. The pixels to overwrite are chosen based on the supplied (overlapping) vector layer.

Coverage.rgbToPctByGDAL.description: Converts a 24 bit RGB image into a 8 bit paletted.Computes an optimal pseudo-color table for the given RGB-image using a median cut algorithm on a downsampled RGB histogram.Then it converts the image into a pseudo-colored image using the color table.This conversion utilizes Floyd-Steinberg dithering (error diffusion) to maximize output image visual quality.

args.name: input
args.description: Input (RGB) raster layer

args.name: ncolors
args.description: The number of colors the resulting image will contain. A value from 2-256 is possible.

args.name: resampling
args.description: Pixel value resampling method to use. Options:0 — Nearest neighbour 1 — Bilinear 2 — Cubic 3 — Cubic spline 4 — Lanczos windowed sinc 5 — Average 6 — Mode 7 — Maximum 8 — Minimum 9 — Median 10 — First quartile 11 — Third quartile

args.description: Sets nodata value for output bands. If not provided, then nodata values will be copied from the source dataset.

It is instead a convenience e.g. when knowing the output coordinates in a geodetic long/lat CRS, but wanting a result in a projected coordinate system.

Coverage.largeScaleMeanShiftVectorByOTB.description: This application chains together the 4 steps of the MeanShift framework, that is the MeanShiftSmoothing, the LSMSSegmentation, the LSMSSmallRegionsMerging and the LSMSVectorization.In this mode, the application will produce a vector file or database and compute field values for each region

args.name: input
args.description: Name of input raster map

args.name: spatialr
args.description: Radius of the spatial neighborhood for averaging. Higher values will result in more smoothing and higher processing time.

args.name: ranger
args.description: Threshold on spectral signature euclidean distance (expressed in radiometry unit) to consider neighborhood pixel for averaging. Higher values will be less edge-preserving (more similar to simple average in neighborhood), whereas lower values will result in less noise smoothing. Note that this parameter has no effect on processing time.

args.name: minsize
args.description: Minimum Segment Size. If, after the segmentation, a segment is of size strictly lower than this criterion, the segment is merged with the segment that has the closest sepctral signature.

args.name: tilesizex
args.description: Size of tiles along the X-axis for tile-wise processing.

args.name: tilesizey
args.description: Size of tiles along the Y-axis for tile-wise processing.

Coverage.largeScaleMeanShiftRasterByOTB.description: This application chains together the 4 steps of the MeanShift framework, that is the MeanShiftSmoothing, the LSMSSegmentation, the LSMSSmallRegionsMerging and the LSMSVectorization.In this mode, the application will produce a standard labeled raster.

args.name: input
args.description: Name of input raster map

args.name: spatialr
args.description: Radius of the spatial neighborhood for averaging. Higher values will result in more smoothing and higher processing time.

args.name: ranger
args.description: Threshold on spectral signature euclidean distance (expressed in radiometry unit) to consider neighborhood pixel for averaging. Higher values will be less edge-preserving (more similar to simple average in neighborhood), whereas lower values will result in less noise smoothing. Note that this parameter has no effect on processing time.

args.name: minsize

args.name: tilesizey

Coverage.meanShiftSmoothingByOTB.description: This application smooths an image using the MeanShift algorithm.

args.name: input
args.description: Name of input raster map

args.name: spatialr
args.description: Radius of the spatial neighborhood for averaging. Higher values will result in more smoothing and higher processing time.

args.name: ranger
args.description: Threshold on spectral signature euclidean distance (expressed in radiometry unit) to consider neighborhood pixel for averaging. Higher values will be less edge-preserving (more similar to simple average in neighborhood), whereas lower values will result in less noise smoothing. Note that this parameter has no effect on processing time.

args.name: thres
args.description: Algorithm will stop if update of average spectral signature and spatial position is below this threshold.

args.name: maxiter
args.description: Algorithm will stop if convergence threshold is not met after the maximum number of iterations.

args.name: rangeramp
args.description: Vary the range radius linearly with the central pixel intensity (experimental).

Coverage.segmentationMeanshiftRasterByOT.description: Performs segmentation of an image, and output a raster file.OTB implementation of the Mean-Shift algorithm (multi-threaded).

args.name: input
args.description: Name of input raster map

args.name: spatialr
args.description: Spatial radius of the neighborhood.

args.name: ranger
args.description: Range radius defining the radius (expressed in radiometry unit) in the multispectral space.

args.name: thres
args.description: Algorithm iterative scheme will stop if mean-shift vector is below this threshold or if iteration number reached maximum number of iterations.

args.name: maxiter
args.description: Algorithm iterative scheme will stop if convergence hasn’t been reached after the maximum number of iterations.

args.name: minsize
args.description: Minimum size of a region (in pixel unit) in segmentation. Smaller clusters will be merged to the neighboring cluster with the closest radiometry. If set to 0 no pruning is done.

Coverage.segmentationMeanshiftVectorByOT.description: Performs segmentation of an image, and output a vector file.OTB implementation of the Mean-Shift algorithm (multi-threaded)

args.name: input
args.description: Name of input raster map

args.name: spatialr
args.description: Spatial radius of the neighborhood.

args.name: ranger
args.description: Range radius defining the radius (expressed in radiometry unit) in the multispectral space.

args.name: thres
args.description: Algorithm iterative scheme will stop if mean-shift vector is below this threshold or if iteration number reached maximum number of iterations.

args.name: maxiter
args.description: Algorithm iterative scheme will stop if convergence hasn’t been reached after the maximum number of iterations.

args.name: minsize
args.description: Minimum size of a region (in pixel unit) in segmentation. Smaller clusters will be merged to the neighboring cluster with the closest radiometry. If set to 0 no pruning is done.

args.name: neighbor
args.description: Activate 8-Neighborhood connectivity (default is 4).

args.name: stitch
args.description: Scan polygons on each side of tiles and stitch polygons which connect by more than one pixel

args.name: minsize
args.description: Objects whose size is below the minimum object size (area in pixels) will be ignored during vectorization.

args.name: simplify
args.description: Simplify polygons according to a given tolerance (in pixel). This option allows reducing the size of the output file or database.

args.name: tilesize
args.description: User defined tiles size for tile-based segmentation. Optimal tile size is selected according to available RAM if null.

args.name: startlabel
args.description: Starting value of the geometry index field

Coverage.ISODATAClusteringForGridsBySAGA.description: This tool executes the Isodata unsupervised classification - clustering algorithm. This is a more sophisticated algorithm which allows the number of clusters to be automatically adjusted during the iteration by merging similar clusters and splitting clusters with large standard deviations. The tool is based on Christos Iosifidis' Isodata implementation.

Coverage.KMeansClassificationByOTB.description: Unsupervised KMeans image classification. This is a composite application, using existing training and classification applications. The SharkKMeans model is used.

args.description: Input image filename.

args.name: nc
args.description: Number of modes, which will be used to generate class membership.

args.name: ts
args.description: Size of the training set (in pixels).

args.name: maxit
args.description: Maximum number of iterations for the learning step. If this parameter is set to 0, the KMeans algorithm will not stop until convergence

args.name: centroids.in
args.description: Input text file containing centroid positions used to initialize the algorithm. Each centroid must be described by p parameters, p being the number of bands in the input image, and the number of centroids must be equal to the number of classes (one centroid per line with values separated by spaces).

args.name: centroids.out
args.description: Output text file containing centroids after the kmean algorithm.

args.name: ram
args.description: Available memory for processing (in MB).

args.name: sampler
args.description: Type of sampling (periodic, pattern based, random)

args.name: sampler.periodic.jitter
args.description: Jitter amplitude added during sample selection (0 = no jitter)

args.name: vm
args.description: Validity mask, only non-zero pixels will be used to estimate KMeans modes.

args.name: nodatalabel
args.description: By default, hidden pixels will have the assigned label 0 in the output image. It’s possible to define the label mask by another value, but be careful to not take a label from another class. This application initializes the labels from 0 to N-1, N is the number of class (defined by ‘nc’ parameter).

args.name: cleanup
args.description: If activated, the application will try to clean all temporary files it created

args.name: rand
args.description: Set a specific random seed with integer value.

args.name: in
args.description: Input image to classify

args.name: vm
args.description: Validity mask (only pixels corresponding to a mask value greater than 0 will be used for learning).

args.name: tp
args.description: Probability for a sample to be selected in the training set.

args.name: som
args.description: Output image containing the Self-Organizing Map.

args.name: ts
args.description: Maximum training set size (in pixels).

args.name: sx
args.description: X size of the SOM map.

args.name: sy
args.description: Y size of the SOM map.

args.name: nx
args.description: X size of the initial neighborhood in the SOM map.

args.name: ny
args.description: Y size of the initial neighborhood in the SOM map.

args.name: ni
args.description: Number of iterations for SOM learning.

args.name: bi
args.description: Initial learning coefficient.

args.name: bf
args.description: Final learning coefficient.

args.name: iv
args.description: Maximum initial neuron weight

args.name: rand
args.description: Set a specific random seed with integer value.

args.name: ram
args.description: Available memory for processing (in MB).

Coverage.SampleExtractionByOTB.description: The application extracts samples values from animage using positions contained in a vector data file.

args.name: in
args.description: Support image

args.name: vec
args.description: Vector data file containing samplingpositions. (OGR format)

args.name: outfield
args.description: Choice between naming method for output fields

args.name: outfield.prefix.name
args.description: Prefix used to form the field names thatwill contain the extracted values.

args.name: outfield.list.names
args.description: Full list of output field names.

args.name: field
args.description: Name of the field carrying the class name in the input vectors.

args.name: layer
args.description: Layer index to read in the input vector file.

args.name: ram
args.description: Available memory for processing (in MB).

Feature.SampleSelectionByOTB.description: The application selects a set of samples from geometries intended for training (they should have a field giving the associated class).

args.name: in
args.description: Support image that will be classified

args.name: mask
args.description: Validity mask (only pixels corresponding to a mask value greater than 0 will be used for statistics)

args.name: vec
args.description: Input geometries to analyse

args.name: instats
args.description: Input file storing statistics (XML format)

args.name: outrates
args.description: Output rates (CSV formatted)

args.name: sampler
args.description: Type of sampling (periodic, pattern based, random)

args.name: sampler.periodic.jitter
args.description: Jitter amplitude added during sample selection (0 = no jitter)

args.name: strategy
args.description: [Set samples count for each class|Set the same samples counts for all classes| Use a percentage of the samples available for each class|Set the total number of samples to generate, and use class proportions.|Set the same number of samples for all classes, with the smallest class fully sampled|Use all samples]

args.name: strategy.byclass.in
args.description: Number of samples by class (CSV format with class name in 1st column and required samples in the 2nd.

args.name: strategy.constant.nb
args.description: Number of samples for all classes

args.name: strategy.percent.p
args.description: The percentage to use

args.name: strategy.total.v
args.description: The number of samples to generate

args.name: field
args.description: Name of the field carrying the class name in the input vectors.

args.name: layer
args.description: Layer index to read in the input vector file.

args.name: elev.dem
args.description: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory. Input DEM tiles should be in a raster format supported by GDAL.

args.name: elev.geoid
args.description: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website (egm96.grd and egm96.grd.hdr at).

args.name: elev.default
args.description: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

args.name: rand
args.description: Set a specific random seed with integer value.

args.name: ram
args.description: Available memory for processing (in MB).

String.TrainImagesClassifierByOTB.description: Train a classifier from multiple pairs of images and training vector data. Samples are composed of pixel values in each band optionally centered and reduced using an XML statistics file produced by the ComputeImagesStatistics application.

args.name: io.il
args.description: A list of input images.

args.name: io.vd
args.description: A list of vector data to select the training samples.

args.name: io.valid
args.description: A list of vector data to select the validation samples.

args.name: io.imstat
args.description: XML file containing mean and variance of each feature.

args.name: io.confmatout
args.description: Output file containing the confusion matrix or contingency table (.csv format).The contingency table is output when we unsupervised algorithms is used otherwise the confusion matrix is output.

args.name: cleanup
args.description: If activated, the application will try to clean all temporary files it created

args.name: sample.mt
args.description: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the training sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available training sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the training sample ratio.

args.name: sample.mv
args.description: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the validation sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available validation sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the validation sample ratio.

args.name: sample.bm
args.description: Bound the number of samples for each class by the number of available samples by the smaller class. Proportions between training and validation are respected. Default is true (=1).

args.name: sample.vtr
args.description: Ratio between training and validation samples (0.0 = all training, 1.0 = all validation) (default = 0.5).

args.name: sample.vfn
args.description: Field containing the class id for supervision. The values in this field shall be cast into integers.

args.name: ram
args.description: Available memory for processing (in MB).

args.name: elev.dem
args.description: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory. Input DEM tiles should be in a raster format supported by GDAL.

args.name: elev.geoid
args.description: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website (egm96.grd and egm96.grd.hdr at).

args.name: elev.default
args.description: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

args.name: classifier
args.description: Choice of the classifier to use for the training.

args.name: classifier.libsvm.k
args.description: SVM Kernel Type.

args.name: classifier.libsvm.m
args.description: Type of SVM formulation.

args.name: classifier.libsvm.c
args.description: SVM models have a cost parameter C (1 by default) to control the trade-off between training errors and forcing rigid margins.

args.name: classifier.libsvm.gamma
args.description: Set gamma parameter in poly/rbf/sigmoid kernel function

args.name: classifier.libsvm.coef0
args.description: Set coef0 parameter in poly/sigmoid kernel function

args.name: classifier.libsvm.degree
args.description: Set polynomial degree in poly kernel function

args.name: classifier.libsvm.nu
args.description: Cost parameter Nu, in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision.

args.name: classifier.libsvm.opt
args.description: SVM parameters optimization flag.

args.name: classifier.libsvm.prob
args.description: Probability estimation flag.

args.name: classifier.boost.t
args.description: Type of Boosting algorithm.

args.name: classifier.boost.w
args.description: The number of weak classifiers.

args.name: classifier.boost.r
args.description: A threshold between 0 and 1 used to save computational time. Samples with summary weight <= (1 - weight_trim_rate) do not participate in the next iteration of training. Set this parameter to 0 to turn off this functionality.

args.name: classifier.boost.m
args.description: Maximum depth of the tree.

args.name: classifier.dt.max
args.description: The training algorithm attempts to split each node while its depth is smaller than the maximum possible depth of the tree. The actual depth may be smaller if the other termination criteria are met, and/or if the tree is pruned.

args.name: classifier.dt.min
args.description: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then this node will not be split.

args.name: classifier.dt.ra
args.description: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split further.

args.name: classifier.dt.cat
args.description: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

args.name: classifier.dt.r
args.description: If true, then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.

args.name: classifier.dt.t
args.description: If true, then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree.

args.name: classifier.ann.t
args.description: Type of training method for the multilayer perceptron (MLP) neural network.

args.name: classifier.ann.sizes
args.description: The number of neurons in each intermediate layer (excluding input and output layers).

args.name: classifier.ann.f
args.description: This function determine whether the output of the node is positive or not depending on the output of the transfer function.

args.name: classifier.ann.a
args.description: Alpha parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

args.name: classifier.ann.b
args.description: Beta parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

args.name: classifier.ann.bpdw
args.description: Strength of the weight gradient term in the BACKPROP method. The recommended value is about 0.1.

args.name: classifier.ann.bpms
args.description: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough.

args.name: classifier.ann.rdw
args.description: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_{ij} in RPROP method (default = 0.1).

args.name: classifier.ann.rdwm
args.description: Update-values lower limit Delta_{min} in RPROP method. It must be positive (default = 1e-7).

args.name: classifier.ann.term
args.description: Termination criteria.

args.name: classifier.ann.eps
args.description: Epsilon value used in the Termination criteria.

args.name: classifier.ann.iter
args.description: Maximum number of iterations used in the Termination criteria.

args.name: classifier.rf.max
args.description: The depth of the tree. A low value will likely underfit and conversely a high value will likely overfit. The optimal value can be obtained using cross validation or other suitable methods.

args.name: classifier.rf.min
args.description: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then the node will not be split. A reasonable value is a small percentage of the total data e.g. 1 percent.

args.name: classifier.rf.ra
args.description: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split.

args.name: classifier.rf.cat
args.description: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

args.name: classifier.rf.var
args.description: The size of the subset of features, randomly selected at each tree node, that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0, then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.

args.name: classifier.rf.nbtrees
args.description: The maximum number of trees in the forest. Typically, the more trees you have, the better the accuracy. However, the improvement in accuracy generally diminishes and reaches an asymptote for a certain number of trees. Also to keep in mind, increasing the number of trees increases the prediction time linearly.

args.name: classifier.rf.acc
args.description: Sufficient accuracy (OOB error).

args.name: classifier.knn.k
args.description: The number of neighbors to use.

args.name: classifier.sharkrf.nbtrees
args.description: The maximum number of trees in the forest. Typically, the more trees you have, the better the accuracy. However, the improvement in accuracy generally diminishes and reaches an asymptote for a certain number of trees. Also to keep in mind, increasing the number of trees increases the prediction time linearly.

args.name: classifier.sharkrf.nodesize
args.description: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then the node will not be split. A reasonable value is a small percentage of the total data e.g. 1 percent.

args.name: classifier.sharkrf.mtry
args.description: The number of features (variables) which will be tested at each node in order to compute the split. If set to zero, the square root of the number of features is used.

args.name: classifier.sharkrf.oobr
args.description: Set the fraction of the original training dataset to use as the out of bag sample.A good default value is 0.66.

args.name: classifier.sharkkm.maxiter
args.description: The maximum number of iterations for the kmeans algorithm. 0=unlimited

args.name: classifier.sharkkm.k
args.description: The number of classes used for the kmeans algorithm. Default set to 2 class

args.name: classifier.sharkkm.incentroids
args.description: Input text file containing centroid posistions used to initialize the algorithm. Each centroid must be described by p parameters, p being the number of features in the input vector data, and the number of centroids must be equal to the number of classes (one centroid per line with values separated by spaces).

args.name: classifier.sharkkm.cstats
args.description: A XML file containing mean and standard deviation to centerand reduce the input centroids before the KMeans algorithm, produced by ComputeImagesStatistics application.

args.name: classifier.sharkkm.outcentroids
args.description: Output text file containing centroids after the kmean algorithm.

args.name: rand
args.description: Set a specific random seed with integer value.

Coverage.segmentationMprofilesdVectorByO.description: Performs segmentation of an image, and output a vector file.Segmentation based on morphological profiles.

args.name: input
args.description: Name of input raster map

args.name: size
args.description: Size of the profiles.

args.name: start
args.description: Initial radius of the structuring element (in pixels).

args.name: step
args.description: Radius step along the profile (in pixels)

args.name: float
args.description: Profiles values under the threshold will be ignored.

args.name: neighbor
args.description: Activate 8-Neighborhood connectivity (default is 4).

args.name: stitch
args.description: Scan polygons on each side of tiles and stitch polygons which connect by more than one pixel

args.name: minsize
args.description: Objects whose size is below the minimum object size (area in pixels) will be ignored during vectorization.

args.name: simplify
args.description: Simplify polygons according to a given tolerance (in pixel). This option allows reducing the size of the output file or database.

args.name: tilesize
args.description: User defined tiles size for tile-based segmentation. Optimal tile size is selected according to available RAM if null.

args.name: startlabel
args.description: Starting value of the geometry index field

Coverage.OpticalCalibrationByOTB.description: The application allows converting pixel values from DN (for Digital Numbers) to reflectance. Calibrated values are called surface reflectivity and its values lie in the range [0, 1].The first level is called Top Of Atmosphere (TOA) reflectivity. It takes into account the sensor gain, sensor spectral response and the solar illuminations.

args.name: input
args.description: Input image filename

args.name: milli
args.description: Flag to use milli-reflectance instead of reflectance.This allows saving the image with integer pixel type (in the range [0, 1000] instead of floating point in the range [0, 1]. In order to do that, use this option and set the output pixel type (-out filename double for example)

args.name: clamp
args.description: Clamping in the range [0, 1]. It can be useful to preserve area with specular reflectance.

args.name: acquiMinute
args.description: Minute (0-59)

args.name: acquiHour
args.description: Hour (0-23)

args.name: acquiMonth
args.description: Month (1-12)

args.name: acquiYear
args.description: Year

args.name: acquiFluxnormcoeff
args.description: Flux Normalization Coefficient

args.name: acquiSolardistance
args.description: Solar distance (in AU)

args.name: acquiSunElev
args.description: Sun elevation angle (in degrees)

args.name: acquiSunAzim
args.description: Sun azimuth angle (in degrees)

args.name: acquiViewElev
args.description: Viewing elevation angle (in degrees)

args.name: acquiViewAzim
args.description: Viewing azimuth angle (in degrees)

args.name: acquiGainbias
args.description: A text file containing user defined gains and biases

args.name: acquiSolarilluminations
args.description: Solar illuminations (one value per band, in W/m^2/micron)

args.name: ram
args.description: Available memory for processing (in MB).

Coverage.OpticalAtmosphericByOTB.description:
The second level is called Top Of Canopy (TOC) reflectivity. In addition to sensor gain and solar illuminations, it takes into account the optical thickness of the atmosphere, the atmospheric pressure, the water vapor amount, the ozone amount, as well as the composition and amount of aerosol gasses.
It is also possible to indicate an AERONET file which contains atmospheric parameters (version 1 and version 2 of Aeronet file are supported. Note that computing TOC reflectivity will internally compute first TOA and then TOC reflectance.

args.name: input
args.description: Input image filename

args.name: acquiGainbias
args.description: A text file containing user defined gains and biases

args.name: acquiSolarilluminations
args.description: Solar illuminations (one value per band, in W/m^2/micron)

args.name: atmoOz
args.description: Stratospheric ozone layer content (in cm-atm)

args.name: atmoWa
args.description: Total water vapor content over vertical atmospheric column (in g/cm2)

args.name: atmoPressure
args.description: Atmospheric Pressure (in hPa)

args.name: atmoOpt
args.description: Aerosol Optical Thickness (unitless)

args.name: atmoAeronet
args.description: Aeronet file containing atmospheric parameters

args.name: atmoRsr
args.description: Sensor relative spectral response file By default the application gets this information in the metadata

args.name: atmoRadius
args.description: Window radius for adjacency effects correctionsSetting this parameters will enable the correction ofadjacency effects

args.name: atmoPixsize
args.description: Pixel size (in km) used tocompute adjacency effects, it does not have tomatch the image spacing

args.name: ram
args.description: Available memory for processing (in MB).

Coverage.OrthoRectificationByOTB.description: This application uses inverse sensor modelling combined with a choice of interpolation functions to resample a sensor geometry image into a ground geometry regular grid. The ground geometry regular grid is defined with respect to a map projection (see map parameter). The application offers several modes to estimate the output grid parameters (origin and ground sampling distance), including automatic estimation of image size, ground sampling distance, or both, from image metadata, user-defined ROI corners, or another ortho-image.A digital Elevation Model along with a geoid file can be specified to account for terrain deformations.In case of SPOT5 images, the sensor model can be approximated by an RPC model in order to speed-up computation.

args.name: ioIn
args.description: The input image to ortho-rectify

args.name: map
args.description: Defines the map projection to be used.

args.name: mapUtmZone
args.description: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)

args.name: mapUtmNorthhem
args.description: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.

args.name: mapEpsgCode
args.description: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection

args.name: outputsMode
args.description: User Defined|Automatic Size from Spacing|Automatic Spacing from Size|Automatic Size from Spacing and output corners|Fit to ortho

args.name: outputsUlx
args.description: Cartographic X coordinate of upper-left corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

args.name: outputsUly
args.description: Cartographic Y coordinate of the upper-left corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

args.name: outputsSizex
args.description: Size of projected image along X (in pixels)

args.name: outputsSizey
args.description: Size of projected image along Y (in pixels)

args.name: outputsSpacingx
args.description: Size of each pixel along X axis (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

args.name: outputsSpacingy
args.description: Size of each pixel along Y axis (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

args.name: outputsLrx
args.description: Cartographic X coordinate of the lower-right corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

args.name: outputsLry
args.description: Cartographic Y coordinate of the lower-right corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

args.name: outputsOrtho
args.description: A model ortho-image that can be used to compute size, origin and spacing of the output

args.name: outputsIsotropic
args.description: Default spacing (pixel size) values are estimated from the sensor modeling of the image. It can therefore result in a non-isotropic spacing. This option allows you to force default values to be isotropic (in this case, the minimum of spacing in both direction is applied. Values overridden by user are not affected by this option.

args.name: outputsDefault
args.description: Default value to write when outside of input image.

args.name: elevDem
args.description: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory. Input DEM tiles should be in a raster format supported by GDAL.

args.name: elevGeoid
args.description: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website (egm96.grd and egm96.grd.hdr at).

args.name: elevDefault
args.description: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

args.name: interpolator
args.description: This group of parameters allows one to define how the input image will be interpolated during resampling.

args.name: interpolatorBcoRadius
args.description: This parameter allows one to control the size of the bicubic interpolation filter. If the target pixel size is higher than the input pixel size, increasing this parameter will reduce aliasing artifacts.

args.name: optRpc
args.description: Enabling RPC modeling allows one to speed-up SPOT5 ortho-rectification. Value is the number of control points per axis for RPC estimation

args.name: optRam
args.description: This allows setting the maximum amount of RAM available for processing. As the writing task is time consuming, it is better to write large pieces of data, which can be achieved by increasing this parameter (pay attention to your system capabilities)

args.name: optGridspacing
args.description: Resampling is done according to a coordinate mapping deformation grid, whose pixel size is set by this parameter, and expressed in the coordinate system of the output image The closer to the output spacing this parameter is, the more precise will be the ortho-rectified image,but increasing this parameter will reduce processing time.

Coverage.BundleToPerfectSensorByOTB.description: This application performs P+XS pansharpening. The default mode use Pan and XS sensor models to estimate the transformation to superimpose XS over Pan before the fusion (“default mode”). The application provides also a PHR mode for Pleiades images which does not use sensor models as Pan and XS products are already coregistered but only estimate an affine transformation to superimpose XS over the Pan.Note that this option is automatically activated in case Pleiades images are detected as input.

args.name: inp
args.description: Input panchromatic image.

args.name: inxs
args.description: Input XS image.

args.name: elevDem
args.description: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory. Input DEM tiles should be in a raster format supported by GDAL.

args.name: elevGeoid
args.description: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website (egm96.grd and egm96.grd.hdr at).

args.name: elevDefault
args.description: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

args.name: mode
args.description: Superimposition mode

args.name: method
args.description: Selection of the pan-sharpening method.

args.name: methodRcsRadiusx

args.name: methodRcsRadiusy
args.description: Set the y radius of the sliding window.

args.name: methodLmvmRadiusx
args.description: Set the x radius of the sliding window.

args.name: methodLmvmRadiusy
args.description: Set the y radius of the sliding window.

args.name: methodBayesLambda

args.name: methodBayesS
args.description: Set the S coefficient.

args.name: lms
args.description: Spacing of the deformation field. Default is 10 times the PAN image spacing.

args.name: interpolator

Coverage.slice.sampleCode:
import oge

oge.initialize()
service = oge.Service()
ls8 = service.getCoverage(coverageID="LC81220392015275LGN00", productID="LC08_L1T")

sliced = service.getProcess("Coverage.slice").execute(ls8, 0,3)
vis_params = {}

sliced.styles(vis_params).getMap("sliced")
oge.mapclient.centerMap(114.30, 30.57, 9)

Cube.load.name: Cube.load
Cube.load.sampleCode:
import oge

oge.initialize()
service = oge.Service()
# 获取指定的Cube数据
sentinelCube = service.getCube(CubeName="Long_sequence_cube", 
	dateTime=["2014-01-16 00:00:00", "2015-01-17 23:59:59"],
	extent=[104.50, 27.2, 104.8, 27.38])
# 进行NDVI操作
vis_params = {"min": 0, "max": 500, "bands": ["Red"], 
	"palette": ["oldlace", "peachpuff", "gold", "olive", "lightyellow", "yellow", "lightgreen", "limegreen", "brown", "lightblue", "blue"]}
# 上色操作
styledCube = sentinelCube.styles(vis_params).map()
oge.mapclient.centerMap(104.65, 27.29, 11)

Coverage.terrFilter.descriptionEn: Filtering based on input rasters and ranges
Coverage.terrFilter.sampleCode:
import oge

oge.initialize()
service = oge.Service()

dem = service.getCoverage(coverageID="ASTGTM_N28E056", productID="ASTER_GDEM_DEM30")
aspect = service.getProcess("Coverage.terrAspect").execute(dem, 1, 1)
aspect_filter = service.getProcess("Coverage.terrFilter").execute(aspect, [0, 180], [90,270], 1)

vis_params = {"min": -1, "max": 1, "palette": ["#808080", "#949494", "#a9a9a9", "#bdbebd", "#d3d3d3","#e9e9e9"]}
aspect_filter.styles(vis_params).getMap("shady_slopes")
oge.mapclient.centerMap(56.25, 28.40, 11)

SpatialStats.GWModels.GWAverage.description: 对特定的空间位置进行局部尺度下均值和中位数的计算，以量化描述在不同尺度下单个空间变量的空间异质性特征
SpatialStats.GWModels.GWAverage.descriptionEn: Calculation of means and medians at local scales for specific spatial locations to quantitatively characterize spatial heterogeneity of individual spatial variables at different scales
SpatialStats.GWModels.GWAverage.sampleCode:
import oge
oge.initialize()
service = oge.Service.initialize()
# use your data for getFeature
feature= service.getFeature(featureId="EasternChina_PopulationAging_Vector")
feature.styles(["#000000"]).getMap("Aging")
oge.mapclient.centerMap(115,31,4)
# GW Average
re_gwss=service.getProcess("SpatialStats.GWModels.GWAverage").execute(feature,"aging", "PCGDP,GI,FD,education",50,"bisquare","true","false")
raster = service.getProcess("Feature_deprecated.rasterizeByGDAL").execute(re_gwss,"PCGDP_LM",0,"False","1",0.01,0.01,"",0)
vis_params = {"palette": ["#ffffcc", "#ffeda0", "#fed976", "#feb24c", "#fd8d3c","#fc4e2a","#e31a1c","#bd0026","#800026"]}
raster.styles(vis_params).getMap("LocalMean")

import oge

# 初始化

service = oge.Service.initialize()

# 生成面要素

Feature_deprecated.shortestPathPointToPo.sampleCode:
import oge
# 初始化
oge.initialize()
service = oge.Service.initialize()

# 读取道路数据
streets = service.getProcess("Feature.load").execute("HC_MainStreets_Case","null","EPSG:4326")
# 选取起点与终点
start = service.getProcess("Feature.point").execute("[114.337475, 30.558570]", "{a:10}", "EPSG:4326")
end = service.getProcess("Feature.point").execute("[114.328842,30.542172]", "{a:10}", "EPSG:4326")
# 最短路径分析
shortestPath = service.getProcess("Feature.shortestPathPointToPointByQGIS").execute(streets, "", "", "114.337475,30.558570 [EPSG:4326]", "2", "0", 0.0, 50.0, "", "114.328842,30.542172 [EPSG:4326]", "", "")
# 可视化
start.styles(["#000000"]).getMap("startPoint") 
end.styles(["#000000"]).getMap("endPoint")
shortestPath.styles(["#000000"]).getMap("shortestPath")
oge.mapclient.centerMap(114.32,30.54,12)

FeatureCollection.cultivatedLandSuitabil.sampleCode:
import oge
oge.initialize()
service = oge.Service.initialize()

landTable = "laiwu_guotubiangeng2023_4527" #shp_guotubiangeng
ecologyTable = "laiwu_shengtaihongxian_4527" #shp_shengtaibaohu_4527
urbanTable = "laiwu_chengzhenkaifa_4527" #shp_chengzhenkaifa_4527
slopeTable = "laiwu_podu_4527" #shp_podu_4527
deprecated = service.getProcess("FeatureCollection.cultivatedLandSuitability").execute(landTable, ecologyTable, urbanTable, slopeTable)
deprecated.export("deprecated")
